title: Stop giving every champion 7000 ways to get out of a bad decision.
body:
All this mobility just creates a game where champions with mobility don't actually have to make a decision because they can just bail out of it on no cooldown (since everything has CDR now). It's maddening.

Edit: Since this got popular here's an idea to fix it rather than just complaining.

If Kassadin uses his ult to escape and not hurt someone it should cost double or triple the normal mana cost. If Ezreal dashes away without hitting anyone should cost A LOT of mana. Tristana uses W to escape? Double mana. Kayn makes a bad decision but uses one of his 879 dashes to bail out? Double mana. Make it so these brainless mobility champions are actually punished for the safety in their kit rather than rewarded for doing whatever the fuck they want since they can just wait 5 seconds and everything is fine.

Ive been saying this for a long time. I always got down voted though. Maybe people are waking up.

It's not just mobility.  Every time a new champ is created they need to make it interesting to players, and the easiest way to do that is have it go over the top or break some rules.

Trouble is that then the players have to play against those champions.  When you enter into a team fight and you have to keep track of five enemy players worth of dashes, a mini game, and some strange mechanics unique to that champion your ability to outplay the enemy team kind of disintegrates.

That's one of the reasons League can feel like such a slog these days.  Even if you can deal with one or two of the enemy team when you get fed there will always be something that makes life hard for your champ on the other side.  Instead of feeling powerful just feel like your always dealing with the next issue to keep track of.

Kind of went too deep on player experience and game design there, but you get the idea.
This is why a champion like {{champion:86}} actually takes more skill to do well/carry with than champs with insane mobility.

He requires more Micro-skill, (or is it macro?) in terms of knowing how to play the game to your advantage, as opposed to playing the champion to your advantage. But saying that someone like Akali is somehow less skillful than Garen is just plain wrong.

Actually I am.

Cause akalis do not have to worry about anything, same with irelias, they have the tools for literally everything.

Hyper mobility. Check.
High damage. Check.
Hard CC. Check.
Range. Check.
Defensive buffs. Check.
Good scaling. Check.
Sustain. Check.

Like literally they have 0 weakness. And can get in or out of every situation with out even having to think about it.

What does a Garen have?

Good defense, good damage. And good sustain at lvl 11+. That's it.

But once again, there's a difference between having a limited Tool Set, and a Complicated Tool Set. Garen's tools are simple, hence why they are limited. A Garen needs to be much more concerned with the Macro of the game, than the Micro, because well there isn't anything that complex. A Garen needs to be concerned with when to engage, how to engage, applying Map pressure, etc. 

Micro, Garen's Job is to Run onto people, Q, Spin, Ult. There's hardly any skill when it comes to the Micro-play, it's why he's such a frustrating champion in lane. Like most Juggernauts, a lot of their skill is in Macro, and a majority of their counterplay too. Garen's main counterplay: Group and Kite him. 

You're confusing Micro and Macro. Garen certainly requires more knowledge in how to affect a map, but skill wise, he does not compare to the Micro an Akali does with her hit and run pattern of fighting.

Just because you have more tools, doesn't make you any less skillful. You still need to know how to apply those tools correctly

Honestly, I'd say that depends on the player.  If a Garen player is trying to dodge skillshots, I'd say that micro play is very much on par or more skill intensive than what an Akali is doing with her shroud.  

Mind you, bad Garen's just charge at people in a straight line and pray they're tanky enough to survive.  That requires about 0 micro play at all, and I've seen a lot of bad Garen players.

I get that, I do. But the basic matter of it all is, that what it takes to play Akali successfully, is nowhere close to how to play Garen. Both Champions will try to dodge skillshots, but Garen's actual combat pattern is nowhere as complex as Akali's, who needs to be moving in and out of range constantly.

Ahh but now we're talking skill floor vs skill ceiling.  The skill floor being the minimum skill required to make something function, while skill ceiling being the maximum skill needed to get the most potential from a character.

Skill floor there is no comparison, Akali requires a higher mechanical skill floor than Garen.  

Skill ceiling?  I honestly am not that sure who's higher.  Yes, an Akali needs to move in and out of range constantly.  Yes she has some neat tricks.  But her abilities actually allow to do her job directly.  While in high level play a Garen needs to be on top of everything just to get to the enemy team once you get to Master rank, while Akali was pick/banned for awhile.  You don't get pick/banned if your character is so complicated that people find her hard to play.  You get pick/banned when, once the character is figured out, they have an easier a time fulfilling their function than similar characters.  Which is exactly what Akali's mobility and true invisibility allow her to do.

Now you can argue that Akali's complexity may be higher.  And yeah, that's why she has a high skill floor.  But I'm going to be honest here.  I come from Starcraft and fighting games, I really don't think any character in this game is actually that complex to get the hang of.  You could maybe make a case for someone like Riven's animation cancelling requiring some pretty precise timing, but even that's a pretty pale comparison to the canceling done in competitive Smash Bros or Guilty Gear.

I'm just not convinced her pattern is so complicated it overrides all the clear advantages she gets to perform the necessary actions in this game.

> I'm just not convinced her pattern is so complicated it overrides all the clear advantages she gets to perform the necessary actions in this game.

And that's a perfectly reasonable argument to make. I'm just adamant in the fact that in no way is Akali easier than Garen.

Skill in league is a combination of micro and macro.

Over all champions like akali and irelia take less skill (micro + macro) than champions like garen or darius.
